title: I think OCE is a trash server compared to NA
body: I'm climbing in NA 200 ping. In a 30 low ping I get too many stupid team mates don't know what to do in this game. I don't care if I get banned in this boards. But my opinion in solo queue NA had way better player than OCE

replies.body:
I honestly agree with OP. Something has changed on OCE over the last 10-12 months. I'm not sure what it is, but the average player is a LOT worse than they used to be. Solo Queue is a fucking NIGHTMARE. June-July last season I was Plat II on my way to Diamond for the first time, took a short break from ranked, came back and players suddenly didn't know how to draft a good team comp, couldn't lane safely, and their macro was horrible. And it's only gotten worse since then.

The only time I can get a decent game nowadays is Flex when I duo/trio queue.

I think it's a combination of factors. Let's list them, compared with, say, Season 5.

* The ability to level up to 30 quicker without really understanding the game.
* The fallout from dynamic queue boosting in Season 6.
* The increase over time of boosters in the game.
* The ability to select positional roles in champion select without learning something about all roles (and hence the game) !
* The fact that smurf accounts are cheap as chips, and prices are dropping further with the removal of rune costs.
* The increase of late night toxic foreign players that have been banned from their own servers (not naming who or where from).
* The increase of new players into the player base, all learning bad habits (this includes toxic behaviour) from other bad players.

I'm not going to go into Flex Queue, which is all over the shop, but what you say is pretty much on the mark. OCE does not understand macro, it's absolutely hopeless. It's better in challenger, but still only at the top levels (just watch IWD's, Big Swip's or Chippy's stream to see).

But the same thing has happened in a lot of regions. NA soloqueue is worse, according to LS. He said that basic lane assignments and late game understanding is worse than when he last played there.

It would be good if the tutorial actually spoke about the basics of the game. i.e. how to efficiently get gold, what are the different classes of champions, and what experience is, because newbies have no idea. Alternatively another solution would be that players need some arbitrary number of wins in normals before they are allowed to rank. This would definitely help the skill gap, but might be counter intuitive to revenue policies :)

I've watched some of my Bronze replays from Jan 2015 and players were way better in Bronze at the simple things (not talking about mechanics here) than even in Gold these days.

Making it more difficult for new players/smurf to jump straight into Ranked would be nice. Honestly, back in the day I was just lucky enough to have friends that straight-up told me no to play ranked for a season or two. People just have selfish mindsets nowadays. They jump straight into ranked at lvl 30. They only play one role, or one champ, and sandbag your game if they don't get it. Hell, even when they do get their main role/champ they neglect cs, they play lane as though kills mean everything and don't know how/when to play safe.

Once upon a time Ranked was sacred. People only queued up for it if their net was fine, their computer was fine, and they had the skills and game knowledge to not be a burden on their team mates.

Pretty much the reason ive played 1 game all week.

I got to the point were i was killing my lane opponent everytime they came back to lane but lo and behold botlanes feeding and we have a hybrid shaco ,i got to a point were i was like fuck this. Quit and went back to playing the forest. Only on oce. .....

The game locks you in to 40+ minute matches with 2-4 anchors, then wonder why the community is so toxic. The ranking system is total garbage and is basically luck.

Most other games ive been playing are free to leave lobbies and matches last about 15 mins max.
When you're bronze with no skills attatch, every thing is luck base; You are basically the same as every 1 else on your team that you called trash.

> [{quoted}](name=CHEESYLEEKS,realm=OCE,application-id=mR0UmRrp,discussion-id=BIF0jAJt,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2017-08-15T01:30:32.751+0000)
>
> Pretty much the reason ive played 1 game all week.
> 
> I got to the point were i was killing my lane opponent everytime they came back to lane but lo and behold botlanes feeding and we have a hybrid shaco ,i got to a point were i was like fuck this. Quit and went back to playing the forest. Only on oce. .....
> 
> The game locks you in to 40+ minute matches with 2-4 anchors, then wonder why the community is so toxic. The ranking system is total garbage and is basically luck.
> 
> Most other games ive been playing are free to leave lobbies and matches last about 15 mins max.

LMAO, the number of players I see as plat/diamond, purely through playing support (badly) and getting carried.
RANK MEANS SOMETHING GUYS!!!

So only you have bad team? the enemy team is all good players? that why you cant climb? 
You are not making sense, or being stuck after so many games played make you think you're better then what you are?

Looking at your games stat. Your just a hella average player at your ranking. You either go even or completly feed most games. The games that look like you are carrying with good KDA; I checked details, and your team mate is carrying you. 

Stop blaming your team all the times. You barely did shit all. No wonder you cant climb eh? You are playing exactly how your rank portrayed.

Check your own dps stat and performance.
https://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=becca+is+hot
do you think NA is better than OCE today ?

Not really. The player base is smaller but not small enough to warrant the skill level of roughly plat and below to differ from the NA plat and below. Higher elo I agree, but low, no, not at all. The only other factors which could influence are ping and culture. Generally OCE has better ping than NA and I feel like OCE culture is a bit more troll at least in the higher ranks although that could be disputed. 

If you think gold in OCE is a shithole, you will think gold in Korea, NA, EUW and EUNE would be as bad if not worse (unless you're being biased) due to the addition of language barriers in some scenarios. 

As a side note, I've played in NA for a couple of years (before OCE was a server) and now in OCE and they're as bad as each other from my experience.

I've played since early season 2, back on NA (before OCE existed).
I've found the complete opposite, NA was far more toxic. But in saying that, I ARAM, where ppl are more chill.

Don't worry! 

Sometimes I wonder how people who are that toxic in the game are even able to communicate out of the game (real life). 

I mean you wouldn't speak to strangers like that in real life, so why do it in the game? 

I understand light banter but there is a fine line between abuse/toxicity and banter.

In terms of 'stupid' teammates are they just bad at the game or are they toxic as well?

we need to look carefully into each players when you have problems like that...

is your team mate a high tier account but playing really bad? toxic?  the boosted accounts have these behavior, they don't care about their account and tiers since they can boost anytime = bad skilled compare to current tier you are in and very toxic.

And the opposite, a player from lowest of low bronze, didn't type anything in chat, have scary kda and win rate 2~3 tier above = boosters doing their work

I do suggest we look through each player and report tickets to riot support, they should take it from there.

Other than that, just enjoy and play I guess~

Regarding comparing NA to OCE though, I was from NA to since beta, transferred to OCE since it's open, up till season 4 the ranked are pretty much peaceful and balanced in OCE, things are going a little off during season5, all the Gold seasonal reward and increasing demand of boosters to boost tiers, nowadays we see boosted/boosters in literal every game in low elo[where any diamond can play and get to gold plat easy]...so ya very poor environment for new players to get used to all the boosted/booster and toxicity.

Don't worry, you wont get banned for having this kind of opinion (it would be more about how you present it, which doesn't seem to be too big an issue in this case). In fact, there are plenty of OCE players who have a similar opinion (and I think it's fair to say there's some truth to it). While I wouldn't say "stupid teammates" (that *might* be something that would lead to a boards ban, with enough consistency), it would seem like the average skill level in OCE is significantly lower, possibly as a result of our lower population.

As a note, this kind of discussion would probably be better suited to the "Gameplay & Strategy", "Miscellaneous" or even "GD" (General Discussion) sub-boards, rather than Team Recruitment.
